alert.note: Alert for Overton; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 9:11PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Overton and central Putnam Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 911 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cookeville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Algood, Monterey, Baxter and Rickman. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 276 and 302. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
